verb.description: Start (a line of text) or position (a block of text, table, etc.) further from the margin than the main part of the text.
Form deep recesses or notches in (a line or surface)
examples: a coastline indented by many fjords

verb.description: Make a requisition or written order for something.
Divide (a document drawn up in duplicate) into its two copies with a zigzag line, thus ensuring identification.

noun.description: A space left by indenting a line or block of text.
An official order or requisition for specified goods or stores.

origin: Late Middle English (as a verb in the sense give a zigzag outline to, divide by a zigzag line): from Anglo-Norman French endenter or medieval Latin indentare, from en-, in- into + Latin dens, dent- tooth.
